itemDescription: British academic and former museum director

wikipedia_page.main: Dame Elizabeth Anne Loosemore Esteve-Coll  (née Kingdon; born 14 October 1938) is a British academic and former museum director and librarian.

response: *  1938   – Elizabeth Esteve-Coll, English curator and academic

In the 1980s, Sir Roy Strong renamed the museum as "The Victoria and Albert Museum, the National Museum of Art and Design". Strong's successor Elizabeth Esteve-Coll oversaw a turbulent period for the institution in which the museum's curatorial departments were re-structured, leading to public criticism from some staff. Esteve-Coll's attempts to make the V&A more accessible included a criticised marketing campaign emphasising the café over the collection.
* Elizabeth Esteve-Coll (née Kingdon) – Director of the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, the first woman to head a national arts institution.
Victor Adebowale, Baron Adebowale, the second Chancellor since its title change in 2001, was installed in 2008. Previous chancellors included Harry Hooper and Dame Elizabeth Esteve-Coll.
